seller_research.name: Whatfix
seller_research.description: Whatfix is an Indian SaaS-based digital adoption platform that provides in-app guidance, training, and performance support for web applications and software.

pricing_models.type: Flat fee plus user license fees
pricing_models.description: Whatfix pricing is based on two components: a flat per-application fee, plus user license fees.
pricing_models.duration: Annual billing, term length varies based on contract

pricing_models.description: Whatfix offers a free plan with 30 credits.
Whatfix offers a basic plan at $39 per month.

buyer_research.name: Experian
buyer_research.description: Experian is a global information services company, which engages in the provision of data and analytical tools that are used to manage credit risk, prevent fraud, target marketing offers and automate decision making solutions.
goals: Target, acquire, manage and develop profitable customer relationships
Provide data and analytical tools to manage credit risk

competitors.name: Appcues
cons: no integration with popular CRM systems

pains: Lack of effective tools for fraud prevention
High implementation costs for new software
Difficulty in measuring ROI on technology investments
Lack of personalized guidance for employees
objections: Whatfix may not be able to integrate with our existing systems
The pricing model may not be suitable for our business needs
We are unsure about the implementation process and its complexity
Whatfix may not be able to provide the level of customization we require
We are concerned about the security and data privacy of Whatfix
We are not convinced about the ROI of investing in a digital adoption platform
Whatfix may not be able to support our global operations
We are unsure about the level of customer support provided by Whatfix
We are comparing Whatfix with other competitors like WalkMe, Pendo, Userpilot, Appcues, and Apty

messages.content: Hello, thank you for taking the time to speak with me today. I'm excited to learn more about Experian's goals and challenges. Can you tell me a little bit about your role and what you're hoping to achieve in the next quarter?

Thank you for having me. My name is Jennifer Schulz, and I'm the CEO of Experian North America. We're looking to improve our credit risk management and fraud prevention capabilities. Our current processes are manual and inefficient, and we're struggling to make informed decisions quickly.
I understand. It sounds like you're facing some significant pain points. Can you tell me more about your current decision-making processes and how you're currently using data analytics?

We're using a combination of manual spreadsheets and some proprietary tools, but it's not scalable and we're not getting the insights we need. We're also struggling to target our marketing offers effectively, and our employees are wasting a lot of time trying to figure out how to use our systems.

I see. It sounds like you're facing some challenges with scalability and user adoption. Have you considered implementing a digital adoption platform to help streamline these processes and provide personalized guidance to your employees?

We've looked at a few options, but we're not sure which one is the best fit for our business. We're concerned about the implementation process and the cost. We're also evaluating WalkMe, Pendo, Userpilot, Appcues, and Apty.

I understand your concerns. Whatfix can help you accelerate digital transformation, drive user adoption, and maximize technology investments. Our implementation process is designed to be flexible and scalable, and our pricing model is based on a flat fee plus user license fees. We also offer a free plan with 30 credits.
That sounds interesting. Can you tell me more about your integration capabilities and how you handle data security and privacy?

Absolutely. Whatfix integrates seamlessly with popular platforms and applications, and we take data security and privacy very seriously. We're fully compliant with all major regulatory requirements, and our security protocols are robust and reliable.
Okay, that's good to know. What kind of ROI can we expect from investing in a digital adoption platform like Whatfix?

Our customers typically see a significant reduction in training time and costs, as well as an increase in employee productivity and efficiency. We've also seen a significant reduction in support tickets and an improvement in overall customer satisfaction.
That sounds promising. What's the next step in the process? How do we get started with Whatfix?

I'd be happy to set up a demo and trial for you to see Whatfix in action. We can also provide a customized ROI analysis to help you understand the potential benefits of our platform. Would that work for you?
Yes, that sounds great. Thank you for your time today. I'm looking forward to learning more about Whatfix.
You're welcome. It was great speaking with you, Jennifer. I'll follow up with you next week to discuss the demo and trial.

pain_points: struggling to make informed decisions quickly
scalability issues with current data analytics tools
difficulty in targeting marketing offers effectively
employees wasting a lot of time trying to figure out how to use systems
success_indicators: significant reduction in training time and costs
increase in employee productivity and efficiency

discovery_questions: Can you tell me a little bit about your role and what you're hoping to achieve in the next quarter?
Can you tell me more about your current decision-making processes and how you're currently using data analytics?
Have you considered implementing a digital adoption platform to help streamline these processes and provide personalized guidance to your employees?
decision_making_process_questions: Can you tell me more about your current decision-making processes and how you're currently using data analytics?

objection_resolution_pairs.resolution: Our implementation process is designed to be flexible and scalable
Our pricing model is based on a flat fee plus user license fees, and we also offer a free plan with 30 credits

insights: Experian is struggling with manual and inefficient current processes, scalability issues with current data analytics tools, difficulty in targeting marketing offers effectively, and employees wasting a lot of time trying to figure out how to use systems
Experian is looking to improve their credit risk management and fraud prevention capabilities
Experian is evaluating multiple digital adoption platforms, including Whatfix, WalkMe, Pendo, Userpilot, Appcues, and Apty
improvements: The seller could have asked more questions about Experian's current decision-making processes and how they're currently using data analytics
The seller could have provided more details about Whatfix's implementation process and scalability
The seller could have emphasized more on Whatfix's unique features, such as AI-powered guidance, to differentiate it from competitors
